channel.title: BUbreakingSectionTwo
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from BUbreakingSectionTwo, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: Trump Endorses Mike Johnson to Continue as House Speaker
item.description: The question of whether the president-elect would back the speaker for another term has hung over Republicans, especially after recent tensions over a...

item.title: Russia and Ukraine Swap More Than 300 Prisoners Ahead of U.S. Transition
item.description: Exchanges have taken place before, but this deal, involving big numbers on both sides, comes as Trump prepares to take over in Washington, potentially...

item.title: Samantha Power: The Humanitarian Legacy of Jimmy Carter
item.description: Jimmy Carter viewed his embrace of human rights as a means of restoring faith in America.

item.title: Russia and Ukraine Swap More Than 300 Prisoners Ahead of U.S. Transition
item.description: Exchanges have taken place before, but this deal, involving big numbers on both sides, comes as Trump prepares to take over in Washington, potentially...

item.title: Walmart dominated, while Target spiraled: the winners and losers of retail in 2024
item.description: Starbucks had a tough year. Orders are getting increasingly complex, and that's led to long lines and incorrect pickup times.

item.title: Hydropower Was Ecuador’s Answer to Climate Change. Until the Drought Hit.
item.description: An extraordinary drought has drained Ecuador’s rivers and reservoirs, leading to power outages of up to 14 hours. Some fear this is the beginning of a...

item.title: Biden Announces $2.5 Billion in Security Aid to Ukraine
item.description: The Treasury Department also released an additional $3.4 billion in budget aid as the Biden administration rushes assistance to Kyiv in its final week...

item.title: Jimmy Carter, Peacemaking President Amid Crises, Is Dead at 100
item.description: Rising from Georgia farmland to the White House, he oversaw the historic Camp David peace accords, but his one-term presidency was waylaid by troubles...

item.title: Syria’s Top Rebel Offers Hint of Timetable for Potetial Elections
item.description: Ahmed al-Shara, who led the rebel offensive that toppled Bashar al-Assad, offered little clarity on what the electoral process might look like.

item.title: Five People Indicted in Connection With Liam Payne’s Fatal Fall
item.description: Two people are accused of supplying the singer with drugs and three others with negligence related to his fall from the balcony of a Buenos Aires hote...

item.title: Elon Musk channels Hillary Clinton in calling Trump supporters ‘contemptible fools’ amid H-1B visa debate
item.description: Musk suggested MAGA hardliners "must be removed from the Republican Party, root and stem.”

item.title: Elon Musk eyes a deal with his native South Africa to let SpaceX offer Starlink service in exchange for a Tesla battery plant, report says
item.description: Musk’s political influence continues to grow.

item.title: Warren Buffett’s Berkshire Hathaway is buying up shares of a lagging 1990s dot-com darling
item.description: Berkshire invested $74 million in domain name and internet infrastructure company VeriSign this month.

item.title: Another Jeju Air jet has landing-gear issue, returns safely
item.description: A Jeju Air Co. jet suffered a landing-gear malfunction on Monday, a day after 179 people died in the country’s worst civil-aviation disaster.

item.title: Olivia Hussey, Teen Star of a ‘Romeo and Juliet’ on Film, Dies at 73
item.description: Her passionate portrayal of Juliet in Franco Zeffirelli’s 1968 adaptation won enduring acclaim. In 2023, she sued over the circumstances of a nude sce...
